meanings.definition: A cosmetic treatment of the hands involving shaping, cutting, and often painting of the nails.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed getting a manicure at the salon.
meanings.sent2: I always feel more put together after a manicure.
meanings.sent3: The manicure made her nails look like tiny rainbows.
meanings.sent4: Her manicure was like a work of art on her fingertips.
meanings.sent5: The manicure added a touch of elegance to her appearance.

meanings.sent1: She decided to manicure her friend's nails for fun.
meanings.sent2: The nail technician will manicure your nails beautifully.
meanings.sent3: He tried to manicure his dog's nails, but it didn't go well.
meanings.sent4: She carefully manicured each nail with precision.
meanings.sent5: The gardener will manicure the bushes in the park next week.

meanings.sent1: Her manicure looked perfect for the party.
meanings.sent2: He admired her elegant manicure during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The manicure on display at the salon caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent4: She waved, showing off her freshly done manicure.
meanings.sent5: The manicure added a pop of color to her outfit.
